column5: Figured I put in Canada thread cuz that's where I'm trying to look ..u used to be able to see daily satellite imagery of southern half Ontario on modis (last yr and beyond). No longer. Anyone know what's up with that? Canada doesn't want US to know their business?
I've been using this site lately.https://worldview.earthdata.nasa.gov...T04%3A00%3A00Z HRG

The MODIS Satellites have reached end of life and are scheduled for vaporization later this year from what I read. I’ve noticed the data has been less and less consistent.The sentinel playground site uses some European satellites. Not daily but ver good imagery. You might find some decen imagery from the VIIRS satellites as well. They have a Great Lakes region that might cover where you are looking.I still like MODIS the best for the lakes I track. Kind of sad they are going away. I’ve been tracking ice outs for dang near 20 springs now.https://apps.sentinel-hub.com/sentin...howDates=falsehttps://cimss.ssec.wisc.edu/viirs/im...olor_wgs84_fit

I really like the Sentinel 2 imagery via Sentinel Hub EO browser, although imagery is not daily, and cloud cover often prevents good viewing. Two days ago (May 2) imagery was pretty good - Cliff (left) and Cedar (right) look pretty rotten, but not open yet. The thing that really appeals to my inner geek about Sentinel Hub is that one can download georeferenced imagery for Avenza Maps - not as high-res as say Google Earth, but better than nothing.
That tip about the Avenza downloads from Sentinel is good to know. Thanks!
